intro: Pedicularis parryi var. mogollonica, commonly known as the Mogollon monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, adapted for pollination by hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
